intro: Chaenostoma affine, commonly known as the common water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves that are typically oval or rounded with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its rhizomes spread horizontally, allowing it to form dense mats on the water surface.
